root: ^You step into a large hallway. Demonic runes cover the black stone wall to wall. Parts of the floor have given way to immeasurable depths, seeming to cut into this world and originating from the purple, gently pulsing portal in the center of the room.

dawnbringerdead: ^As you approach the portal, it suddenly swells into a swirling gateway, enveloping the room in a bright red and purple light. Two massive claws reach out from the portal, clutching two of the black pillars before the monstrous demon reveals himself.

^<color=red>"YOU RETURN, MY CHAMPION!"</color> The demon proclaims with glee, then pauses. <color=red>"And without that self-righteous gnat at your side, I am impressed. This should be interesting..."</color>
dawnbringeralive: ^The growling portal creates a strong contrast to the lone figure in front of the gateway. The Dawnbringer looks up, resignation visible in his intense expression.

c-4: ^A deep, demonic chuckle fills the Citadel's throne room, as a massive arm emerges, swiping the Dawnbringer aside. <color=red>"YOU RETURN MY CHAMPION. IT IS TIME THEN, TO SETTLE THIS ONCE AND FOR ALL!"</color>

dawnbringer: ^"Stand back, [[class]]. This isn't your fight. I am here to end this eternal conflict once and for all!"

c-5: ^"Do you believe this is the first time we've tried to rid ourselves of these demons? That I am the first 'Champion' sent to push them back?"

^"This battle has been going on for eons. Cycle after cycle, day and night... We are nothing but the playground of the gods we pretend to worship and the demons we pretend to revile. And -I- will end it all!"
c-6: ^"I will summon the architect of this Hellscape. A parasite who feeds off all of the strife and desperation born of this eternal back-and-forth."
c-7: ^"You have shown me I don't have to take on this burden alone - together, we will push back this plague on our realm. And if nothing else, at least it will provide respite from the madness we find ourselves in."
^"I will summon the architect of this Hellscape. A parasite who feeds off all of the strife and desperation born of this eternal back-and-forth."

demonreveal: ^The Dawncaster finishes the incantation, instantly bringing the portal to life. Moments later, a massive hand appears, reaching for the winged Champion of Light.

c-8: ^You reach for your [[weapon]] and strike at the hand. A thundering chuckle shakes the vestments of the sanctum as the demon emerges from the swirling gateway.
^<color=red>"Ah - how curious. Looks like our 'Champion' brought friends."</color> The demon grins tauntingly at you, then at the Dawnbringer.

demon: ^A large, demonic hand suddenly appears and reaches out from the portal towards the Dawnbringer. Before the man can utter another word, a loud crunch marks the unceremonious end of the former Champion.
^A deep, demonic chuckle fills the Citadel's throne room. <color=red>"This never ceases to amuse me."</color> the bellowing voice mutters as the demon emerges from the portal.
^The demon takes a deep breath, savoring the moment before it turns its attention to you. <color=red>"As for you, my 'Champion', let us settle this- once and for all!"</color>
demondawnbringer: ^The demon looks bemused for a moment then glances back at the red smudge scattered over the black tiles on the floor. <color=red>"Oh but you are, [[class]], this fool was just... misguided by those who should know better."</color>
demonoptions: ^The demon looks bemused for a moment. <color=red>"Oh but you are, [[class]]. You are the one that made it all the way down here, did you not? A true champion of your fragile species."</color>
^Fight: I'll show you just how 'fragile' we are!
answerstories: ^<color=red>"Why? Why does anyone do anything? Because I -LIKE- it, Champion. To see hope snuffed out like a candle in this moment of desperation- it is... "</color> the demon takes another deep breath as the air crackles around him. <color=red>"...glorious."</color>
^Fight: I've heard enough of your lies!
stories: ^Another laugh echoes down the grand hall of the Citadel. <color=red>"You still cling to those stories? Do you really think your gods care about what goes on on this broken plane?"</color>

^<color=red>"All these lies, all to tell yourself you have not been abandoned out here - to tell yourself hope is just around the corner. All this desperation is what keeps me coming back for more, and more, and more..."</color>
^I'll make sure this is the last!

c-16: ^<color=red>"Ah, so brightly your candle burns - I will savor snuffing it out."</color>
